source.body: When working with the E. coli, be very diligent and make sure you are working in the sterile area of your bench near the bunsen burner flame.

Plate all of transformation onto LB agar plate(s) with ampicillin.

Incubate plates at
overnight.
Select 10-15 colonies from each agar plate to suspend in an LB solution.

source.body: We originally selected only 4 colonies from each plate, but did not have a successful PCR. To increase chances of successfully amplifying the plasmid vector, we suggest picking 10-15 colonies.

source.description:
Place tubes into shaking incubator at
overnight.

source.body: Strong suggestion to do this whole section sometime in the late afternoon (~4-5pm), so that you can run PCR for the bacterial plasmids you collect the next morning (~16 hours later). More than 24 hours of incubation can cause other non-ampicillin resistant bacteria to grow in the suspension tubes.

source.description: Proportions for the Master PCR Mix are below. Simply multiply each value by the same amount (x 10, 15, etc.) according to how much master mix you think you'll need to run your sets.

source.description: Seal off PCR wells tightly with a clear plastic cover or tube tops.

Centrifuge
.

Place in thermocycler and run PCR. Settings should be as follows:
1) 95C for 5mins (ramp up).
2) 95C for 30sec.
3) 55C for 45 sec.
4) 72C for 45 sec.
- x35 cycles steps 2-4.
5) 72 for 10mins.
Prepare a gel of 2% concentration. Run gel and examine bands. Desired band length is about 200bp with the gRNA insertion.
You have successfully transformed a lentiviral vector with your gRNA sequence of interest! For confirmation, feel free to sequence your vector.

of LB.
